metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10928 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.6-0, a heap-based buffer over-read in the GetNextToken function in token.c allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted SVG document that is mishandled in the GetUserSpaceCoordinateValue function in coders/svg.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8').
